{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Design Engineer",
  "description": "Doheney Services Limited helps businesses work more efficiently and effectively by providing tech, admin, and structured staff, all within the budget provided. The company has been working with businesses in Nigeria, the UK, and some other parts of the world, to help them do better work for less money. Doheney services can take over tedious tasks like hiring new suitable employees, project management, or even creating reward systems.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Design Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Design Engineer is responsible for preparing accurate HVAC, VRF, and plumbing system designs, calculations, and cost inputs, while coordinating with architects, consultants, and vendors to deliver technically compliant and coordinated design solutions.


Responsibilties


	Proven experience in HVAC, VRF, and plumbing system design.
	Ability to independently carry out engineering calculations and prepare design documentation.
	Strong proficiency in AutoCAD; experience with other design software is an advantage.
	Experience coordinating with architects, consultants, and equipment vendors.
	Exposure to estimation, BOQ preparation, or tender support is an advantage


Requirements


	Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role.
	Ability to independently carry out engineering calculations and prepare design documentation.
	Proven experience in HVAC, VRF, and plumbing system design.
	Strong proficiency in AutoCAD; experience with other design software is an advantage.
	Skills and Competencies:
	Strong technical and analytical skills with attention to detail.
	Good communication skills for effective coordination with internal and external stakeholders.
	Ability to manage multiple design tasks and meet deadlines.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.
	Team-oriented mindset with the ability to work independently when required.


Salary
N450,000 monthly.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;rjackson@doheneyservices.com&nbsp;using &quot;Design Engineer&quot; as the subject of the email.",

Design Engineer Job at Doheney Services Limited




        
    

        
        Doheney Services Limited helps businesses work more efficiently and effectively by providing tech, admin, and structured staff, all within the budget provided. The company has been working with businesses in Nigeria, the UK, and some other parts of the world, to help them do better work for less money. Doheney services can take over tedious tasks like hiring new suitable employees, project management, or even creating reward systems.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Design Engineer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Design Engineer is responsible for preparing accurate HVAC, VRF, and plumbing system designs, calculations, and cost inputs, while coordinating with architects, consultants, and vendors to deliver technically compliant and coordinated design solutions.


Responsibilties


	Proven experience in HVAC, VRF, and plumbing system design.
	Ability to independently carry out engineering calculations and prepare design documentation.
	Strong proficiency in AutoCAD; experience with other design software is an advantage.
	Experience coordinating with architects, consultants, and equipment vendors.
	Exposure to estimation, BOQ preparation, or tender support is an advantage


Requirements


	Minimum of 5 years of experience in a similar role.
	Ability to independently carry out engineering calculations and prepare design documentation.
	Proven experience in HVAC, VRF, and plumbing system design.
	Strong proficiency in AutoCAD; experience with other design software is an advantage.
	Skills and Competencies:
	Strong technical and analytical skills with attention to detail.
	Good communication skills for effective coordination with internal and external stakeholders.
	Ability to manage multiple design tasks and meet deadlines.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.
	Team-oriented mindset with the ability to work independently when required.


Salary
N450,000 monthly.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: rjackson@doheneyservices.com using "Design Engineer" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Area Customer Manager",
  "description": "Alan &amp; Grant -&nbsp;Our client&nbsp;provides a unified distribution platform, digitizing the chain from distributors to retailers.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Area Customer Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos

Job Summary


	The Area Customer Manager (ACM) is responsible for driving customer acquisition, retention, revenue growth, and operational excellence of the Lending business within an assigned territory.
	The role oversees distributors, field teams (Team Leads and Relationship Officers), and key distributor customers, ensuring growth of BNPL business, execution of commercial strategy, credit discipline, and service quality at the area level.


Key Responsibilities
Business Growth &amp; Revenue Management:


	Drive BNPL GMV, retention, revenue, and volume growth across the assigned territory in line with regional targets.
	Execute customer acquisition and activation strategies for distributors.
	Identify growth opportunities within the area, including white spaces and underpenetrated markets.


Customer &amp; Distributor Management:


	Manage relationships with distributors, key accounts, and strategic customers within the area.
	Ensure distributors meet agreed service levels, coverage expectations, and operational standards.
	Resolve customer issues promptly to maintain high satisfaction and retention levels.


Credit, Collections &amp; Risk Management:


	Enforce credit policies and ensure adherence to approved credit limits.
	Monitor outstanding balances, NPL levels, and recovery performance within the area.
	Work closely with recovery teams to drive collections and minimize credit risk.


Field Execution &amp; Operations:


	Supervise and support field sales officers, recovery agents, and customer-facing teams.
	Ensure daily, weekly, and monthly execution of field activities and route plans.
	Monitor productivity, coverage, and efficiency of field teams.


Performance Management &amp; Reporting:


	Track area-level KPIs including GMV, customer acquisition, retention, NPL, collections, and field productivity.
	Prepare and submit accurate performance reports to the Regional Customer Manager.
	Analyze performance trends and recommend data-driven actions for improvement.


People Leadership &amp; Capability Development:


	Coach, train, and mentor field teams to improve sales effectiveness and customer engagement.
	Identify skill gaps and support training initiatives within the area.
	Foster a performance-driven, ethical, and customer-centric culture


Stakeholder Collaboration:


	Work closely with Regional Customer Manager, Credit, Operations, Finance, and HR teams.
	Support rollout of new products, systems, and process improvements within the area.
	Provide market intelligence and customer insights to support regional and head-office decision-making.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business, Marketing, Economics, or a related field.
	5 &ndash; 8 years of experience in open market sales, customer management, distribution, or FMCG/fintech operations.
	Proven experience managing FMCG distributors, field teams, or large customer portfolios is a major requirement.
	Strong understanding of credit management and collections.
	Experience working in fast-paced, target-driven environments.
",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-29",
  "validThrough": "2026-03-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Alan & Grant"
    
  },

}



Area Customer Manager Job at Alan & Grant




        
    

        
        Alan & Grant - Our client provides a unified distribution platform, digitizing the chain from distributors to retailers.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Area Customer Manager

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Area Customer Manager (ACM) is responsible for driving customer acquisition, retention, revenue growth, and operational excellence of the Lending business within an assigned territory.
	The role oversees distributors, field teams (Team Leads and Relationship Officers), and key distributor customers, ensuring growth of BNPL business, execution of commercial strategy, credit discipline, and service quality at the area level.


Key Responsibilities
Business Growth & Revenue Management:


	Drive BNPL GMV, retention, revenue, and volume growth across the assigned territory in line with regional targets.
	Execute customer acquisition and activation strategies for distributors.
	Identify growth opportunities within the area, including white spaces and underpenetrated markets.


Customer & Distributor Management:


	Manage relationships with distributors, key accounts, and strategic customers within the area.
	Ensure distributors meet agreed service levels, coverage expectations, and operational standards.
	Resolve customer issues promptly to maintain high satisfaction and retention levels.


Credit, Collections & Risk Management:


	Enforce credit policies and ensure adherence to approved credit limits.
	Monitor outstanding balances, NPL levels, and recovery performance within the area.
	Work closely with recovery teams to drive collections and minimize credit risk.


Field Execution & Operations:


	Supervise and support field sales officers, recovery agents, and customer-facing teams.
	Ensure daily, weekly, and monthly execution of field activities and route plans.
	Monitor productivity, coverage, and efficiency of field teams.


Performance Management & Reporting:


	Track area-level KPIs including GMV, customer acquisition, retention, NPL, collections, and field productivity.
	Prepare and submit accurate performance reports to the Regional Customer Manager.
	Analyze performance trends and recommend data-driven actions for improvement.


People Leadership & Capability Development:


	Coach, train, and mentor field teams to improve sales effectiveness and customer engagement.
	Identify skill gaps and support training initiatives within the area.
	Foster a performance-driven, ethical, and customer-centric culture


Stakeholder Collaboration:


	Work closely with Regional Customer Manager, Credit, Operations, Finance, and HR teams.
	Support rollout of new products, systems, and process improvements within the area.
	Provide market intelligence and customer insights to support regional and head-office decision-making.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Economics, or a related field.
	5 – 8 years of experience in open market sales, customer management, distribution, or FMCG/fintech operations.
	Proven experience managing FMCG distributors, field teams, or large customer portfolios is a major requirement.
	Strong understanding of credit management and collections.
	Experience working in fast-paced, target-driven environments.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Project Manager",
  "description": "Food Concepts commenced operations in 2001. From inception, our aim has been clear-cut and focused: to revolutionize the food sector in West Africa and to deliver extraordinary satisfaction to our stakeholders.

Since launching in 2004, Chicken Republic (Subsidiary of Food concepts) has already opened 55 stores in Nigeria and Ghana. On this basis, we are proud of the brand&rsquo;s hard-earned reputation as the fastest growing chicken QSR in West Africa and the number 1 chicken QSR in Nigeria (both in revenues and number of outlets). In addition, Chicken Republic was ranked as one of Nigeria&rsquo;s top 20 brands across all categories (Financial Standards Awards 2009).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Project Manager
Requisition ID: 2021
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	A Project Manager specializing in structures oversees and manages construction projects with a focus on structural elements.
	This role involves everything related to project and time management


Core Responsibilities and Key Result Areas
Project Management:


	Responsible for the development of all acquired sites according to standards and specifications
	Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects
	Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget
	Develop project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility
	Ensure availability and allocation of resources
	Develop a detailed project work plan to track progress
	Use appropriate verification techniques to manage changes in project schedule and costs
	Measure project performance using appropriate systems, tools and techniques
	Manage the relationship between client and all stakeholders and escalate to management as needed
	Establish and maintain relationship with third party vendors
	Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation
	Track project performance specifically to analyse the successful completion of short and long-term goals
	Responsible for Liaising /negotiating with building or developing contractors &amp; consultants in conjunction with the technical &nbsp;&nbsp;
	Partners throughout the life span of each project.
	Review and seek approvals for all architectural proposals and drawings of all sites
	Risk Management/ Compliance
	Perform risk management to minimize project risks
	Ensure adequate compliance to all company policies, internal control processes and approved processes
	Ensure compliance with territorial governments&#39; judgments, statutes and laws while acquiring and developing sites


Key Performance Indicators


	Estimated rate of project completion
	Projects return on investment (ROI)
	Time spent on the project by team members
	Level of resource capacity i.e. number of resources working on a project multiplied by the&nbsp;
	percentage of time
	Number of project milestones completed within the required timeline


Job Specifications


	Have tertiary qualifications in Civil Engineering or a similar field
	Minimum of 5-6 Previous of experience in structures such as tunnels, culverts, bridges, etc.
	Possession of A Post Graduate Degree is an added advantage
	Project Management Professional (PMP)/ PRINCE II Certification is a &nbsp;Plus
	Good understanding and demonstrative experience in civil engineering and technical elements


Knowledge Requirements:


	Knowledge of team management and leadership
	Good negotiation skills
	Knowledge of project scheduling
	Knowledge of cost and risk and cost management
	Knowledge of contract management and suppliers
	Knowledge of processes in the Food/QSR industry
	Strong organizational and managerial skills.


Decision Expectations:


	Ensure Projects are delivered on time, within scope and budget,
	Ensure all Acquired sites are developed according to standards and specifications
	Enforces agreed decisions
	Maintains Comprehensive Project Documentation

Project Manager Job at Food Concepts Plc




        
    

        
        Food Concepts commenced operations in 2001. From inception, our aim has been clear-cut and focused: to revolutionize the food sector in West Africa and to deliver extraordinary satisfaction to our stakeholders.

Since launching in 2004, Chicken Republic (Subsidiary of Food concepts) has already opened 55 stores in Nigeria and Ghana. On this basis, we are proud of the brand’s hard-earned reputation as the fastest growing chicken QSR in West Africa and the number 1 chicken QSR in Nigeria (both in revenues and number of outlets). In addition, Chicken Republic was ranked as one of Nigeria’s top 20 brands across all categories (Financial Standards Awards 2009).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

            
    



Job Position: Project Manager
Requisition ID: 2021
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Purpose


	A Project Manager specializing in structures oversees and manages construction projects with a focus on structural elements.
	This role involves everything related to project and time management


Core Responsibilities and Key Result Areas
Project Management:


	Responsible for the development of all acquired sites according to standards and specifications
	Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects
	Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget
	Develop project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility
	Ensure availability and allocation of resources
	Develop a detailed project work plan to track progress
	Use appropriate verification techniques to manage changes in project schedule and costs
	Measure project performance using appropriate systems, tools and techniques
	Manage the relationship between client and all stakeholders and escalate to management as needed
	Establish and maintain relationship with third party vendors
	Create and maintain comprehensive project documentation
	Track project performance specifically to analyse the successful completion of short and long-term goals
	Responsible for Liaising /negotiating with building or developing contractors & consultants in conjunction with the technical   
	Partners throughout the life span of each project.
	Review and seek approvals for all architectural proposals and drawings of all sites
	Risk Management/ Compliance
	Perform risk management to minimize project risks
	Ensure adequate compliance to all company policies, internal control processes and approved processes
	Ensure compliance with territorial governments' judgments, statutes and laws while acquiring and developing sites


Key Performance Indicators


	Estimated rate of project completion
	Projects return on investment (ROI)
	Time spent on the project by team members
	Level of resource capacity i.e. number of resources working on a project multiplied by the 
	percentage of time
	Number of project milestones completed within the required timeline


Job Specifications


	Have tertiary qualifications in Civil Engineering or a similar field
	Minimum of 5-6 Previous of experience in structures such as tunnels, culverts, bridges, etc.
	Possession of A Post Graduate Degree is an added advantage
	Project Management Professional (PMP)/ PRINCE II Certification is a  Plus
	Good understanding and demonstrative experience in civil engineering and technical elements


Knowledge Requirements:


	Knowledge of team management and leadership
	Good negotiation skills
	Knowledge of project scheduling
	Knowledge of cost and risk and cost management
	Knowledge of contract management and suppliers
	Knowledge of processes in the Food/QSR industry
	Strong organizational and managerial skills.


Decision Expectations:


	Ensure Projects are delivered on time, within scope and budget,
	Ensure all Acquired sites are developed according to standards and specifications
	Enforces agreed decisions
	Maintains Comprehensive Project Documentation
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Marketing Executive",
  "description": "Urielsprout Limited is an innovative, excellence-driven human capital development organization committed to transforming individuals and organizations through bespoke training, career guidance, and business advisory services. Our primary focus is on employability skills training, job matching (internships and paid employment), SIWES placements, business advisory, and support services. We also provide general capacity development training and workshops aimed at upskilling teams within organizations. Our goal is to elevate workforce readiness, enhance employability, and foster business success by equipping clients with skills and support needed to thrive in competitive markets. We leverage strategic partnerships to drive substantial positive impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Executive

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties
Sales &amp; Marketing Activities:


	Identify and prospect potential clients for the company&rsquo;s financial products and services
	Promote funding intermediation, SME financing, consumer financing, investment, and advisory services.
	Carry out market outreach through field visits, referrals, and digital channels.
	Convert leads into customers and support client onboarding processes.


Client Relationship Management:


	Build and maintain strong relationships with new and existing clients.
	Provide accurate information on products, services, and benefits to clients.
	Follow up on leads, inquiries, and customer feedback to improve conversion rates.
	Ensure a positive client experience throughout the engagement process.


Reporting &amp; Performance Tracking:


	Submit regular reports on marketing activities, leads generated, and conversions achieve- Meet assigned sales targets and performance objectives.
	Support management with market insights and customer feedback.


Compliance &amp; Professional Conduct:


	Ensure all marketing activities comply with company policies and regulatory guidelines.
	Maintain confidentiality of company and client information.
	Uphold professionalism and ethical conduct in all client interactions.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a minimum of SSCE, OND, or equivalent qualification, with prior experience in marketing, sales, or client acquisition considered an advantage.
	Applicants must have strong communication and persuasion skills, a good understanding of customer engagement, and the ability to work independently while meeting targets.
	Candidates must reside in Lagos State and be willing to engage in field marketing activities.


Salary
N85,000 - N100,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to:&nbsp;urielsproutrecruits@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Application for Marketing Executive Role&quot; as the subject of the email.",

Marketing Executive Job at Urielsprout Limited




        
    

        
        Urielsprout Limited is an innovative, excellence-driven human capital development organization committed to transforming individuals and organizations through bespoke training, career guidance, and business advisory services. Our primary focus is on employability skills training, job matching (internships and paid employment), SIWES placements, business advisory, and support services. We also provide general capacity development training and workshops aimed at upskilling teams within organizations. Our goal is to elevate workforce readiness, enhance employability, and foster business success by equipping clients with skills and support needed to thrive in competitive markets. We leverage strategic partnerships to drive substantial positive impact.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Executive

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties
Sales & Marketing Activities:


	Identify and prospect potential clients for the company’s financial products and services
	Promote funding intermediation, SME financing, consumer financing, investment, and advisory services.
	Carry out market outreach through field visits, referrals, and digital channels.
	Convert leads into customers and support client onboarding processes.


Client Relationship Management:


	Build and maintain strong relationships with new and existing clients.
	Provide accurate information on products, services, and benefits to clients.
	Follow up on leads, inquiries, and customer feedback to improve conversion rates.
	Ensure a positive client experience throughout the engagement process.


Reporting & Performance Tracking:


	Submit regular reports on marketing activities, leads generated, and conversions achieve- Meet assigned sales targets and performance objectives.
	Support management with market insights and customer feedback.


Compliance & Professional Conduct:


	Ensure all marketing activities comply with company policies and regulatory guidelines.
	Maintain confidentiality of company and client information.
	Uphold professionalism and ethical conduct in all client interactions.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a minimum of SSCE, OND, or equivalent qualification, with prior experience in marketing, sales, or client acquisition considered an advantage.
	Applicants must have strong communication and persuasion skills, a good understanding of customer engagement, and the ability to work independently while meeting targets.
	Candidates must reside in Lagos State and be willing to engage in field marketing activities.


Salary
N85,000 - N100,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: urielsproutrecruits@gmail.com using "Application for Marketing Executive Role" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "IT / Admin Officer",
  "description": "Urielsprout Limited is an innovative, excellence-driven human capital development organization committed to transforming individuals and organizations through bespoke training, career guidance, and business advisory services. Our primary focus is on employability skills training, job matching (internships and paid employment), SIWES placements, business advisory, and support services. We also provide general capacity development training and workshops aimed at upskilling teams within organizations. Our goal is to elevate workforce readiness, enhance employability, and foster business success by equipping clients with skills and support needed to thrive in competitive markets. We leverage strategic partnerships to drive substantial positive impact.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT / Admin Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a proactive and organized IT/Admin Officer to support daily IT operations and administrative functions within our client&rsquo;s organization.
	The Ideal candidate will provide IT support to staff, manage office systems and documentation, and ensure smooth day-to-day administrative operations in line with company policies.


Job Description
IT Support &amp; Systems Management:


	Provide first-level technical support to staff on hardware, software, and network-related issues.
	Maintain and troubleshoot computers, printers, internet connectivity, and office IT equipment.
	Ensure proper setup, regular updates, and basic security of IT systems.
	Manage data backups and support basic information security practices.


Administrative &amp; Office Operations:


	Handle general administrative duties, including documentation, filing, and record-keeping.
	Manage office supplies, vendors, and service providers.
	Support internal communication and coordination across departments.
	Assist with scheduling, correspondence, and report preparation.


Compliance &amp; Operational Support:


	Support documentation for regulatory, audit, and internal compliance processes.
	Maintain confidentiality of company and client information.
	Ensure adherence to company policies and operational procedures.


Requirements


	OND / HND / Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in IT, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field
	1&ndash;2 years of experience in an IT support or administrative role
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
	Basic knowledge of computer systems, networking, and troubleshooting
	Strong organizational and documentation skills
	Good communication and interpersonal skills
	High level of integrity, discretion, and attention to detail
	Must reside in Lagos State.


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 monthly.

IT / Admin Officer Job at Urielsprout Limited




        
    

        
        Urielsprout Limited is an innovative, excellence-driven human capital development organization committed to transforming individuals and organizations through bespoke training, career guidance, and business advisory services. Our primary focus is on employability skills training, job matching (internships and paid employment), SIWES placements, business advisory, and support services. We also provide general capacity development training and workshops aimed at upskilling teams within organizations. Our goal is to elevate workforce readiness, enhance employability, and foster business success by equipping clients with skills and support needed to thrive in competitive markets. We leverage strategic partnerships to drive substantial positive impact.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: IT / Admin Officer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a proactive and organized IT/Admin Officer to support daily IT operations and administrative functions within our client’s organization.
	The Ideal candidate will provide IT support to staff, manage office systems and documentation, and ensure smooth day-to-day administrative operations in line with company policies.


Job Description
IT Support & Systems Management:


	Provide first-level technical support to staff on hardware, software, and network-related issues.
	Maintain and troubleshoot computers, printers, internet connectivity, and office IT equipment.
	Ensure proper setup, regular updates, and basic security of IT systems.
	Manage data backups and support basic information security practices.


Administrative & Office Operations:


	Handle general administrative duties, including documentation, filing, and record-keeping.
	Manage office supplies, vendors, and service providers.
	Support internal communication and coordination across departments.
	Assist with scheduling, correspondence, and report preparation.


Compliance & Operational Support:


	Support documentation for regulatory, audit, and internal compliance processes.
	Maintain confidentiality of company and client information.
	Ensure adherence to company policies and operational procedures.


Requirements


	OND / HND / Bachelor’s Degree in IT, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field
	1–2 years of experience in an IT support or administrative role
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
	Basic knowledge of computer systems, networking, and troubleshooting
	Strong organizational and documentation skills
	Good communication and interpersonal skills
	High level of integrity, discretion, and attention to detail
	Must reside in Lagos State.


Salary
N100,000 - N120,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: urielsproutrecruits@gmail.com using "Application for IT/Admin Role" as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
